brief: This is a Soundfile Player which allows to play back and manipulate soundfiles.

methods.name: removeFromCache()
methods.desc:
Remove this SoundFile's decoded audio sample from the cache, allowing
 it to be garbage collected once there are no more references to this
 SoundFile.

methods.name: channels()
methods.desc: Returns the number of channels of the soundfile as an int (1 for mono, 2 for stereo).

methods.name: cue()
methods.desc: Cues the playhead to a fixed position in the soundfile.

methods.name: duration()
methods.desc: Returns the duration of the soundfile in seconds.

methods.name: frames()
methods.desc: Returns the number of frames of this soundfile.

methods.name: play()
methods.desc: Starts the playback of the soundfile.

methods.name: jump()
methods.desc: Jump to a specific position in the soundfile while continuing to play (or starting to play if it wasn't playing already).

methods.name: pause()
methods.desc: Stop the playback of the file, but cue it to the current position.

methods.name: isPlaying()
methods.desc: Check whether this soundfile is currently playing.

methods.name: loop()
methods.desc: Starts playback which will loop at the end of the soundfile.

methods.name: amp()
methods.desc: Changes the amplitude/volume of the player.

methods.name: pan()
methods.desc: Move the sound in a stereo panorama.

methods.name: rate()
methods.desc: Set the playback rate of the soundfile.

description:
This is a Soundfile player which allows to play back and manipulate sound
 files. Supported formats are: WAV, AIF/AIFF, and MP3.
 
 MP3 decoding can be very slow on ARM processors (Android/Raspberry Pi), we generally recommend you use lossless WAV or AIF files.
name: SoundFile

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: filename of the sound file to be loaded

parameters.name: cache
parameters.description:
keep the sound data in RAM once it has been decoded (default: true).
            Note that caching essentially disables garbage collection for the
            SoundFile data, so if you are planning to load a large number of audio
            files, you should set this to false.
